source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: This Act may be cited as the Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016. It extends to the whole of the Punjab and shall come into force on such date as the Government may, by notification, specify, with different dates possible for various areas.

source_type: Punjab Protection act of women against violence 2016
source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Defines key terms used in the Act including: 'aggrieved person' (a female subjected to violence), 'Committee' (District Women Protection Committee), 'Court' (Family Court), 'domestic violence' (violence by a person with whom the aggrieved lived in a domestic relationship), 'Protection Centre', 'shelter home', and 'violence' (offences including domestic, sexual, psychological, economic abuse, stalking, or cybercrime). It also defines subcategories such as 'economic abuse' and 'psychological violence'.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Notwithstanding any other law, an aggrieved person who is a victim of domestic violence shall not be evicted from her house without her consent or except in accordance with law. If wrongfully evicted, the Court shall restore her position if she has a right, title, or beneficial interest in the house. She may also choose to reside in the same house, in alternative accommodation arranged by the defendant as per his financial capacity, or in a shelter home.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Pending proceedings under this Act, the Court may pass an interim order at any stage of the complaint as it deems just and proper. If the Court is satisfied, on the basis of an affidavit or other material, that the defendant has committed or is likely to commit an act of violence, it may issue such interim order accordingly.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: If the Court is satisfied that any violence has been or is likely to be committed, it may issue a protection order directing the defendant to avoid communication, stay away, maintain a specified distance, wear a GPS tracker, vacate the house, surrender weapons, refrain from aiding violence, or avoid the aggrieved person's residence or workplace. The Court may impose additional conditions or require a bond to prevent violence. The Court may also direct police or Women Protection Officers to assist in enforcement.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: In cases of domestic violence, the Court may issue a residence order ensuring that the aggrieved person is not evicted from the house, may stay there, or may be relocated to a shelter home for protection and rehabilitation. The Court may direct the defendant to hand over property or documents, restrict the defendant or relatives from approaching the aggrieved person, or arrange alternative accommodation or rent. Financial circumstances of the parties must be considered before such orders.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: At any stage of trial, the Court may direct the defendant to provide monetary relief to cover expenses and losses suffered by the aggrieved person, including compensation for economic abuse, loss of earnings, medical expenses, property loss, shelter expenses, and maintenance for herself and dependent children. The Court shall consider the financial resources of both parties and may direct payments through employers or debtors if the defendant defaults.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Interim, protection, or residence orders shall remain in force for the period specified by the Court. The Court may alter or discharge any order with written reasons and must discharge an order upon the aggrieved person’s application. The aggrieved person may also file a fresh application after a previous order has been discharged.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The Government shall constitute a District Women Protection Committee for each district, headed by the District Coordination Officer and consisting of key district officials and four nominated civil society members. The Committee shall meet at least once every three months, function without remuneration, and can have members removed for misconduct or misuse of powers. A Vice Chairperson shall be nominated from among the non-official members.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The Committee shall supervise Protection Centres, shelter homes, and helplines; ensure high-quality response; facilitate mediation and reconciliation; ensure referral of cases of violence to Protection Centres; approve annual plans; monitor and evaluate operations; engage volunteers; and recommend improvements to the protection system. It may accept donations and delegate functions to the District Coordination Officer as prescribed.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The Government shall establish Protection Centres as one-stop facilities for aggrieved women providing police reporting, medical examination, forensic collection, legal aid, counseling, and immediate protection. Shelter homes shall offer board, lodging, rehabilitation, vocational training, and support services for women and their children. Male children above dependent age shall be referred to the Child Protection and Welfare Bureau.

source_name: The Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The Government shall appoint a District Women Protection Officer (DWPO) and Women Protection Officers. The DWPO shall supervise the protection system, coordinate activities, train staff, approve rescues, file habeas corpus petitions, and report on system performance. Women Protection Officers shall rescue victims, admit them to shelter homes, provide counseling, enforce short-term eviction of defendants if necessary, and handle helpline and field duties.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The District Women Protection Officer or a Women Protection Officer may enter any place or house at any time to rescue an aggrieved person but shall not rescue her without consent. Entry requires prior notice, and if access is denied, entry may be forced with police assistance. Only a female officer may exercise such power in a woman’s abode.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The District Women Protection Officer or a Women Protection Officer shall provide assistance to any aggrieved woman upon request or credible information, in collaboration with district authorities including police, but no assistance shall be given if refused by the woman.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Designated police officers, agencies, and local governments are bound to assist Protection Officers in carrying out their duties under this Act. Committees may demand information from any district agency or local government, which must comply.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Any person obstructing a District or Women Protection Officer in performing duties under this Act is liable to imprisonment up to six months or a fine up to five hundred thousand rupees, or both.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Any person providing false information about violence, knowing or believing it to be false, is punishable by imprisonment up to three months or a fine between fifty thousand and one hundred thousand rupees, or both.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: A defendant breaching an interim, protection, residence, or monetary order, or interfering with the GPS tracker, is punishable by imprisonment up to one year or a fine between fifty thousand and two hundred thousand rupees, or both. Repeated violation leads to imprisonment up to two years and a fine between one hundred thousand and five hundred thousand rupees.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Courts shall not take cognizance of offences under this Act except upon a complaint by a District or Women Protection Officer. Trials shall follow summary procedure as per Chapter XXII of the Code of Criminal Procedure.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: A person aggrieved by any interim, protection, residence, or monetary order, or by a sentence, may appeal within thirty days to the court of sessions, which shall decide within sixty days. The decision shall be final.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The Government shall, within seven days of receiving information about violence, publish case details and protective actions on its website, unless withheld to ensure safety, privacy, national security, or protection of identities.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: All persons engaged in or employed for the administration of this Act shall be deemed public servants under section 21 of the Pakistan Penal Code, 1860.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The Government shall periodically conduct performance audits of the district protection systems, reviewing service quality, target achievement, weaknesses, and providing recommendations for improvement.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The provisions of this Act are in addition to and not in derogation of any other law, unless otherwise provided.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The Government shall regularly train District Women Protection Officers, Women Protection Officers, and other staff of the protection system to achieve the objectives of the Act.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Within three months of each financial year’s end, the Government shall submit an annual report to the Provincial Assembly detailing services, rescue operations, delays, audits, reforms, and other relevant matters.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: The Government shall, by notification, make rules within 120 days for implementing the Act, including mechanisms for monitoring, toll-free numbers, committee meetings, volunteer management, donations, assistance, rehabilitation, and record maintenance.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: No suit or legal proceeding shall lie against the Government, its officers, committees, or officials for actions done in good faith under this Act or its rules.

source_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
text: Within two years of commencement, the Government may issue notifications to resolve difficulties or implement provisions consistent with this Act.
